com.kinvey
Class KCSClient

java.lang.Object
  com.kinvey.KCSClient

public class KCSClient
extends Object

Top level access to all services.

Method Detail

getInstance

public static KCSClient getInstance(Context context,
                                    KinveySettings settings)
Gets the application context from the context passed in to ensure no transient Activity contexts are passed.

Parameters:
context - used to get access to disk for caching and faster code
settings - used to provide appkey and app secret to the library for access to kinvey service
Returns:
a thread safe singleton instance helper class to gain access to standard kinvey services

resource

public KinveyResource resource(String assetName)
Convenience method to create KinveyResource instance for a given file.

Parameters:
assetName - short name of the file with extension if known ahead of time
Returns:
a new KinveyResource instance

collection

public EntityCollection collection(String name)
Convenience method to create EntityCollection instances for a given collection.

Parameters:
name - The name for which to map the collection
Returns:
A new EntityCollection instance

enablePush

public boolean enablePush(Application application)
Enables PUSH messaging service. KinveySettings used on KCSClient initialization must contain appropriate PUSH key/secret for the selected PUSH mode (debug/production). If no mode is specified, debug will be assumed. Refer to KinveySettings for more information on appropriate property keys to use. Note: This method should only be called after getInstance(Context context, KinveySettings settings) has been called

Parameters:
application - Application instance
Returns:
false if KCSClient has not been initialized, true

entity

public EntityDict entity(String collectionName)
Convenience method to create EntityDict instances for a given collection.

Parameters:
collectionName - The collection for which to map the entity
Returns:
A new EntityDict instance

getApplicationContext

public Context getApplicationContext()
The application context set for this client

Returns:
application context is used by the client to gain access to the flash memory for caching operations

getActiveUser

public KinveyUser getActiveUser()
The user that has been authenticated and logged in to the kinvey service. All authenticated requests to the kinvey service will utilize this user object

Returns:
the active user for authenticated requests to the Kinvey service.

getCurrentUser

public KinveyUser getCurrentUser()
Deprecated. use getActiveUser() instead

The user that has been authenticated and logged in to the kinvey service. All authenticated requests to the kinvey service will utilize this user object

Returns:
the active user for authenticated requests to the Kinvey service.

cacheddata

public CachedStore cacheddata(MappedAppdata backedBy,
                              Class<? extends MappedEntity> mappedClazz)
Creates a cached datastore.

Parameters:
backedBy - the mapped appdata instance that this store is backed by
mappedClazz - the class instance in which to map objects from the Kinvey server to local Java objects.
Returns:
a cached data store

isKinveyReachable

public boolean isKinveyReachable()
                          throws KinveyException
Unauthenticated ping. Verifies the server is reachable.

Returns:
true if the connection to the server is up
Throws:
KinveyException

isKinveyReachable

public void isKinveyReachable(KinveyCallback<Boolean> cb)
Unauthenticated ping. Verifies the server is reachable.

Calls KinveyCallback with the result of the network request to Kinvey. Boolean.TRUE if the connection is up.

pingService

public boolean pingService()
                    throws KinveyException

Authenticated ping used to check connectivity and user credentials to the kinvey service.

WARN requires a user context has been established.

Returns:
true if successful
Throws:
KinveyException - if any the goes wrong with the network request

pingService

public void pingService(KinveyCallback<Boolean> cb)

Authenticated ping used to check connectivity and user credentials to the kinvey service.

WARN requires a user context has been established.

Parameters:
cb - the callback that will be invoked once the network request completes or fails

setCurrentUser

public void setCurrentUser(KinveyUser u)
If the user is known ahead of time, otherwise use KinveyUserImpl.initializeCurrentUser() method

Parameters:
u - saves the current user for authorization

setPushIntentReceiver

public void setPushIntentReceiver(Class<? extends BroadcastReceiver> receiver)
Set the application's BroadcastReceiver class to be used when a new PUSH message is received. This receiver should handle the following actions: KCSPush.ACTION_PUSH_RECEIVED PUSH message was received KCSPush.ACTION_NOTIFICATION_OPENED PUSH message was opened from the notification bar KCSPush.ACTION_REGISTRATION_FINISHED PUSH registration has completed and application is ready to receive PUSH messages.

Parameters:
receiver -

setPushNotificationBuilder

public void setPushNotificationBuilder(KCSPushNotificationBuilder builder)
Sets the notification builder to use when constructing the Notification to display to the user in the notification bar

Parameters:
builder - KCSPushNotificationBuilder Notification builder instance

settings

public KinveySettings settings()
Settings instance that is loaded.

Returns:
All kinvey specific settings.

createUserWithUsername

public void createUserWithUsername(String username,
                                   String password,
                                   KinveyCallback<KinveyUser> cb)
Asynchronous convenience factory method used to create a new user associated with the configured Kinvey app backend.

Throws:
KinveyException - when user create on the server fails to return 201 - CREATED, server response is included in the exception message

loginWithFacebookAccessToken

public void loginWithFacebookAccessToken(String validAccessToken,
                                         KinveyCallback<KinveyUser> cb)
Asynchronous Kinvey login method for users that have been authenticated with Facebook.

Parameters:
validAccessToken - the token acquired by the facebook sdk
cb - callback on success will return the newly logged in user otherwise onFailure will be called

loginWithGoogleAuthToken

public void loginWithGoogleAuthToken(String authToken,
                                     KinveyCallback<KinveyUser> cb)
Asynchronous Kinvey login method for users that have been authenticated with Google.

Parameters:
authToken - valid authentication token returned from google
cb - callback on success will return the newly logged in user otherwise onFailure will be called

loginWithUsername

public KinveyUser loginWithUsername(String username,
                                    String password)
Login the user with the username and password. If the user does not exist and error will be returned.

You must be sure a user exists when calling this method. You can obtain a new user by calling createUserWithUsername(String, String, KinveyCallback) first.

Parameters:
username - the name of the user to login
password - a valid password for this user (all communication to the server is over a securely encrypted socket)
Returns:
an instance of the user object that was logged in.

loginWithUsername

public void loginWithUsername(String username,
                              String password,
                              KinveyCallback<KinveyUser> cb)
Asynchronously login the user with the given username and password and sets the current user see getActiveUser(). If the user does not exist an error will be returned

You must be sure a user exists when calling this method. You can obtain a new user by calling createUserWithUsername(String, String, KinveyCallback) first.

Parameters:
username - a unique string to identify the user
password - a valid password in plain text (all communication with the server is secure)
cb - an object that will be notified with the request has failed or succeeds.

userCollection

public UserCollection userCollection()
Retrieve UserCollection for querying app users

Returns:
an instance of the user collection for this app

isPushEnabled

public boolean isPushEnabled()
Used to check if push notifications are enabled.

Returns:
true if push is enabled otherwise false
